title: SB 1.18.31 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 19-04-2023 | Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: whether he had just been feigning trance just to avoid receiving the lower kshatriya
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the context of Pariksit Maharaj and a sage, questioning the sage's true state of meditation.

segments.key_quote: His connections with Srila Shukadeva Goswami would enable the presentation of the great Srimad Bhagavatam which is considered to be the book incarnation of the Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker explains the divine plan behind Pariksit Maharaj's curse, leading to the presentation of Srimad Bhagavatam by Shukadeva Goswami.

segments.key_quote: accepted the curse and he retired from his position as the emperor of the world, handed over charge to his grown up son and he went away to a holy place to prepare for death
segments.summary: The speaker describes Pariksit Maharaj accepting the curse, renouncing his kingdom, and preparing for death in a holy place.

segments.key_quote: Shukadeva Goswami who appeared in that place where Pariksit was sitting in order to prepare for his death
segments.summary: The speaker narrates Shukadeva Goswami's arrival and Pariksit Maharaj's inquiry about preparing for death, leading to the speaking of Srimad Bhagavatam.

segments.key_quote: this book incarnation of the Lord gives much fascinating information on the transcendental pastimes of the Lord like his Rasaleela
segments.summary: The speaker highlights the significance of Srimad Bhagavatam, particularly the Rasaleela, and its power to destroy mundane sex desire and establish one in devotional service.

segments.key_quote: Apparently Parikshit was frustrated therefore he did this. But actually it was arranged by the Lord that his devotee becomes an instrument for Bhagavatam to prosper.
segments.summary: The speaker explains how the Lord uses frustration to elevate devotees and facilitate divine events, using the example of Pariksit Maharaj and Arjuna.

segments.key_quote: Sir Krishna could speak through Arjuna to all of us the Bhagavad Gita. So Brahma says by placing King Pariksit in an awkward position, the incarnation of Sriman Bhagavatam was created by the will of the Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on Arjuna's frustration leading to Bhagavad Gita and connects it to Pariksit Maharaj's situation, emphasizing the Lord's plan in creating Srimad Bhagavatam.

segments.key_quote: The King's distressed condition was certainly unprecedented. The devotees like Maharaj Pariksit are powerful enough to forbear self-distress by the will of the Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker argues that Pariksit Maharaj's distress was part of the Lord's plan, highlighting the devotee's ability to endure and the Lord's control over the situation.

segments.key_quote: Pariksit was not at all at fault because of an arrangement of the Lord so that Bhagavatam could be spoken by Shukadeva Swami to Pariksit Maharaj
segments.summary: The speaker concludes that Pariksit Maharaj was not at fault, as the entire situation was arranged by the Lord for the sake of Srimad Bhagavatam's revelation.
